attributes.action: teach black history and the plight of black people in primary schools
attributes.additional_details: primary school is where young children begin to learn and make their minds up about what they believe in and what is wrong. The only way to evolve our country into become racially acceptable to all is to teach children what really happened in the past and the consequences it has on black people and give them a chance to make up their own mind and make a difference the same as we do with global warming issues.
attributes.background: to include black history as a core topic in learning the same way  the Nazi regime is taught. Black history and the plight of black people should be taught to every child to discourage discrimination

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
